key_dates.description: First turning point date for January 2026
Second turning point date for January 2026
Third turning point date for January 2026

seasonal: Bitcoin tends to be bullish in January. In 9 out of the last 15 years, Bitcoin finished January in positive territory (60% of years). However, Bitcoin has a shorter history compared to other assets, making seasonal statistics less reliable. Seasonally, in 7 out of the last 8 years (approximately 87%), Bitcoin closed higher on Jan 6 than on Jan 1. Two weekly cycles exist, with weeks ending on Jan 16 and Jan 23, where the cycle ending Jan 23 is considered very strong.

statistics.description: In 7 out of the last 8 years, Bitcoin traded higher on Jan 6 than on Jan 1 (approximately 87%)

insights: Bitcoin is at a pause before either a decline or a return to rally - after the sharp move in November, December turned into a corrective month of consolidation and digestion
The month started with a sharp decline, but the price quickly stabilized and began building a tightening consolidation (narrowing range)

Bitcoin has a pattern unique to itself: rallies of 35 months upward followed by 14 months of decline - currently we may be near the third occurrence of this pattern, with wave 5 of the rally possibly nearing completion since October 2025

Even within a strong downtrend, the initial rebound often looks like an upside bounce first, and only afterward does the primary trend full reversal to the key support zone between $70,000-$78,000 reveal itself
The $70,000-$78,000 zone is the central support area for a full reversal of the primary trend - this is a critical zone
As long as the price holds above this area, there is no reason to panic; it creates buying opportunities for medium-term positions with clear risk management
If Bitcoin reaches the $95,000+ area, this would signal renewed upward momentum and potential for further upside toward the resistance zone at $98,384-$104,349
Conversely, a break below $84,400 and then below $80,600 would signal increasing weakness and higher probability of continued decline to the weekly support zones
D9 indicator, used for identifying extreme zones, registered a reading of 7, which in the context of the weekly chart suggests the uptrend type N pattern may be timing its transition point
RSI (2 time units) also shows signs of a potential bottom forming, similar to indicators seen in the past
The 100-week moving average continues to serve as significant support and price has been leaning on it consistently

The daily chart shows Bitcoin stabilizing within a narrowing consolidation - building a choppy structure that tightens over time, making the breakout direction unclear but defining clear decision points
Breakout above $95,000 signals bullish momentum renewal; breakdown below $84,400 then $80,600 signals bearish continuation
Daily turning point dates in the Jan 15-16 window align with the weekly cycles, making this area worth watching for a significant trend change
Dates between Jan 2-4 and Jan 26-29 are likely to produce heightened volatility sequences
Crypto market is characterized by high dynamics and fast volatility, requiring real-time monitoring via the Discord community for proper decision-making

support.description: First key breakdown level - a break below signals growing weakness
Second breakdown level - break below this leads to weekly chart support zones
Central support zone for a full primary trend reversal - the key area to watch if a major decline develops

resistance.description: Breakout level - establishing above this signals renewed upward momentum
Resistance zone on the weekly chart - daily chart resistance levels appear in this range

technical.indicators: D9 indicator at 7, signaling potential extreme zone. RSI (2 time units) showing signs of potential bottom. 100-week moving average serving as consistent support. Weekly chart showing N-type wave pattern. Daily chart shows tightening consolidation with narrowing range. The weekly Elliot wave structure suggests we may be in wave 5 of the primary rally from the 2022 lows, and an AB=CD pattern comparison is being watched.

summary: Bitcoin enters January 2026 in a consolidation phase after a sharp November rally and a corrective December. The price is building a tightening range (choppy/sideways) between approximately $84,400 support and $95,000 resistance. Seasonally, January tends to be bullish (60% of years positive), with key turning points on Jan 3, 16, 22, and 27-28. The most critical zone to watch is the $70,000-$78,000 support, which represents the full reversal point of the primary trend.
previous_month_review: December 2025 had four turning point dates for Bitcoin. The first (Dec 1) worked - provided the 'low' of the previous move. The second (Dec 11) arrived one day early - served as the 'high' of the previous cycle. The third (Dec 18) worked - provided the 'low' of the previous cycle. The fourth (Dec 27) did not work - however, it was not traded because Bitcoin was in a tight choppy range making it impractical.
risk_notes: Bitcoin may be nearing the end of a 35-month rally cycle (the third occurrence of this historical pattern), suggesting potential for a 14-month decline phase
Crypto markets are characterized by extreme dynamics and fast volatility - real-time monitoring is essential
A break below $84,400 and then $80,600 would signal a significant shift toward the downside
The $70,000-$78,000 zone represents the full primary trend reversal area - a break below would be extremely bearish
Even initial rebounds within a developing downtrend can look like rallies, creating false confidence
This is not investment advice - the content is for educational purposes only
